messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Little Hollydodd
messages.msgSnippet: ... still ... When I introduce Lars to someone who knows him but hasn t seen him for a long time, I refer to him as my baby .  That s said looking up, way up,
messages.messageBody:
>
> Kass & Kree asked DH and me when we will stop referring to them as "the
> babies", to which we replied, "Never."
>
> They were like, "So when we are grandmas and you are still alive you'll
still
> call us the babies? "
>
> DH said it faster than me, "Sure, you'll still be our babies." They walked
> away rolling their eyes and smiling at the same time.

When I introduce Lars to someone who knows him but hasn't seen him for a
long time, I refer to him as "my baby". That's said looking up, way up, at
him. But he'll always be my baby because he's my last.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary
saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Little Hollydodd
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/1/03 9:42:10 AM Pacific Standard Time, ... LOL Kass & Kree asked DH and me when we will stop referring to them as the babies , to which
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/1/03 9:42:10 AM Pacific Standard Time,
strandbe@... writes:

> And the mommy in me is shocked that Holly is 11!! My head knew that,
> but I still see her as a darling little girl playing with a dollhouse
> here.
>

LOL

Kass & Kree asked DH and me when we will stop referring to them as "the
babies", to which we replied, "Never."

They were like, "So when we are grandmas and you are still alive you'll still
call us the babies? "

DH said it faster than me, "Sure, you'll still be our babies." They walked
away rolling their eyes and smiling at the same time.

Rhonda


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Little Hollydodd
messages.msgSnippet: And the mommy in me is shocked that Holly is 11!! My head
messages.messageBody:
<<The woman in me will be proud that day, but the mommy in me wishes
they could
stay little.

Rhonda>>

And the mommy in me is shocked that Holly is 11!! My head knew that,
but I still see her as a darling little girl playing with a dollhouse
here.

"Time flies" is SO much more than just a saying. Time is a damned
freight train.

Susan (we used to refer to Holly as Hollydodd 'cause it was such a cute
name)
